intro: Quintinia hyehenensis, commonly known as the New Zealand whitebeam, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded foliage and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces white, bell-shaped flowers in clusters, which are followed by bright red, fleshy berries. Quintinia hyehenensis is adapted to the cool, moist climates of its native habitat and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of New Zealand's native flora.
